usefulItems: sealable storage jar or container, large bowl, silicone bread mat, plastic wrap, 2 baking trays (30 x 40 cm), refrigerator, oven
title: Strawberry chocolate calzones

ingredients.content: 60 g olive oil, plus extra for greasing (see Tips)
150 g plain flour, plus extra for dusting
16 - 24 strawberries (approx. 250 g), hulled and cut into slices

preparations.content: Place hazelnuts into mixing bowl and mill <b>35 sec/speed 9<b> or until finely ground. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add all remaining hazelnut chocolate spread ingredients and blend <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend <b>1 min/speed 6<b> or until smooth. Transfer into a sealable jar or container and place into refrigerator until ready to use (spread will thicken slightly in refrigerator). Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Lightly grease a large bowl and set aside.
Place water, sugar and yeast into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 2<b>.

Add flours, oil and salt and knead <b>2 min/<b>. Transfer dough onto a lightly floured work surface or silicone bread mat and knead until dough is smooth and no longer sticky. Transfer into prepared bowl, cover with plastic wrap and set aside in a warm place to prove for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Lightly flour 2 large baking trays (30 x 40 cm) and set aside.

Transfer dough onto a floured work surface or silicone bread mat and divide into 8 equal portions (approx. 60 g each). Roll each portion into an oval shape (approx. 16 x 13 cm). Spread 3 teaspoons of the reserved Hazelnut chocolate spread over half of each oval (to 1 cm from edge). Top with strawberry slices (approx. 2-3 strawberries per calzone). Fold over other half of calzone and press edges together, then twist edges to seal. Carefully transfer calzones onto prepared baking trays. Bake for 15 minutes (200°C), or until golden. Serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: You can use homemade Hazelnut chocolate spread (see pg. 184) or store-bought for this recipe. Homemade spread is the much healthier option, as commercial spreads tend to contain mainly sugar and refined vegetable oil.
I recommend using a lighter-flavoured extra virgin olive oil as it's much milder.
